task.title: Add logging for debugging
task.description:
## Context
Add structured logging throughout Toolsmith for debugging and observability.

## Implementation Hints

**Recommended Model:** haiku
**Estimated Duration:** 1h
**Approach:** Use Python logging module, follow Cub logging patterns.

## Implementation Steps
1. Review existing Cub logging patterns in `cub/utils/logging.py`
2. Add logger to each Toolsmith module
3. Log at appropriate levels:
   - DEBUG: HTTP requests/responses, parsing details
   - INFO: Sync started/completed, search queries
   - WARNING: Partial failures, retries
   - ERROR: Failed operations
4. Include relevant context (source name, tool count, timing)
5. Ensure `--debug` flag enables DEBUG level

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Each module has its own logger
- [ ] Sync operations log start, progress, completion
- [ ] HTTP requests log URL and status (at DEBUG)
- [ ] Errors include relevant context
- [ ] `--debug` flag enables verbose logging
- [ ] Log format matches Cub conventions
- [ ] mypy passes with strict mode

## Files Likely Involved
- `src/cub/core/toolsmith/service.py` (modify)
- `src/cub/core/toolsmith/store.py` (modify)
- `src/cub/core/toolsmith/sources/*.py` (modify all)
- `src/cub/cli/toolsmith.py` (modify)

## Notes
- Use `logging.getLogger(__name__)` pattern
- Don't log sensitive data (though Toolsmith has none)
- Consider structured logging for future metrics
